snippet: Roger Federer came closer than many people probably expected to winning a record eighth Wimbledon men’s crown and becoming its oldest men’s champion.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Tennis column notes that hopes of Hollywood ending for Roger Federer to win his eighth Wimbledon tittle placed his opponent Novak Djokovic in role of supporting actor, if not actual villain; after losing tense and hard-fought match, Federer promises crowd he will return next year;
lead_paragraph: Roger Federer came closer than many people probably expected to winning a record eighth Wimbledon men’s crown and becoming its oldest men’s champion.

headline.seo: Wimbledon 2014: Roger Federer Narrowly Misses a Title in His Twilight
headline.main: No Storybook Finish at Wimbledon, but Hope for More Chapters
headline.print_headline: No Storybook Finish, but Hope for More Chapters
